title: Add first-entry “Do you love me?” mini-game with evasive No button

requirements.text: Add a first-entry prompt overlay that appears before revealing the Valentine page content, asking the user “Do you love me?” with exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”, and keep all other existing page sections and behavior unchanged once the user proceeds.

quotes: First enter ayedapudu oka game petu like do u love me ani no yes two options ... megatadi as it is petu

acceptanceCriteria: On initial app load, the user sees a prompt asking “Do you love me?” with two visible buttons: “Yes” and “No”.
The existing Valentine experience (Surprise reveal + sections) does not render until the user completes this prompt.
After proceeding past the prompt, the rest of the site behaves exactly as before (including replay behavior).
All user-facing text for this new prompt is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the “No” option behavior so that when the user attempts to select “No”, the “No” button moves/jumbles vertically (up/down) within the prompt area to avoid being selected, while the “Yes” button remains stable and can be selected normally to proceed.

quotes: no option select cheste adi jumble avali like up and down only yes option select chese la vundali

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping “No” causes the “No” button to change position vertically (up/down) in a noticeable way within the prompt container.
The “No” button movement stays within the prompt UI bounds (does not overlap outside the overlay or become unreachable/off-screen).
The “Yes” button remains clickable and stationary at all times.
Selecting “Yes” proceeds to the existing experience flow (the current SurpriseReveal and then the main page content).

constraints: Do not change backend behavior; keep backend/main.mo as-is unless strictly required (it should not be required for this feature).
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/* or frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
Keep the rest of the Valentine page content, sections, and mini-games unchanged aside from inserting this new first-entry prompt flow.
nonGoals: Adding authentication, persistence, or tracking for the Yes/No choice.
Adding additional answer options beyond Yes/No.
Changing existing Valentine page copy, games, or styling beyond what is necessary to integrate the new first-entry prompt.
